str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Eleven. From heis and deka; one and ten, i.e. Eleven.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up. From epi and airo; to raise up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To speak out, declare. From apo and phtheggomai; to enunciate plainly, i.e. Declare.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Vocative Masculine Plural
str2: To dwell in, settle in, be established in (permanently), inhabit. From kata and oikeo; to house permanently, i.e. Reside.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Known, an acquaintance. From ginosko; well-known.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To take into my ear, give ear to, listen to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
